definition: to sign one's name/visa/variant of 籤|签[qian1]
inscribed bamboo stick (used in divination, gambling, drawing lots etc)/small wood sliver/label/tag

sentences.english: MKCCC and Good Shepherd Community Church agreed to co-operate on building project.
sentences.chinese: 美坚堂与善牧堂正式签署建堂合作计划。

sentences.english: Please return the form, duly completed and signed, to our Public Office.
sentences.chinese: 请于填妥及签署表格后将其交回卓佳投资者服务处。

sentences.english: Have reached a shopping direction, sales and customers purchase contract signed.
sentences.chinese: 已达成购物方向后，销售人员和客户签署购销合同。

sentences.english: Any deletion or amendment must be initialed by all account holders.
sentences.chinese: 任何删除或修改必须由客户签署作实。

sentences.english: If any edits are made to the document, then the signature will become invalid .
sentences.chinese: 如果任何修改了该文件，然后签署将成为无效。

sentences.english: Informed consent should not be a mere contract for research participants to sign.
sentences.chinese: 知情同意不应该仅仅是一个让研究参与者签署的合同。

sentences.english: It said a bilateral agreement was signed in Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 声明称，双方在北京签署了双边协议。

sentences.english: It is believed that the signing of these documents would help expand areas of bilateral cooperation.
sentences.chinese: 相信这些文件的签署将有助于扩大双边合作领域。

sentences.english: But in mos tcompanies these days, a signed statement from the past employee is needed.
sentences.chinese: 现今在大多数的公司里，都会和雇员签署声明。

sentences.english: NDA agreement MUST be signed before proceeding with anything.
sentences.chinese: 协议必须签署保密协议之前，任何意外。

sentences.english: They all signed "mutual assistance" pacts making them virtual protectorates of the Soviet Union.
sentences.chinese: 他们都签署了使自己几乎受制于苏联的“互惠条约”。

sentences.english: These are administrative matters of signing agreements, " he said.
sentences.chinese: 这些只是签署协定的行政方面的问题。

sentences.english: No deal with Israel will stick unless both Palestinian groups endorse it.
sentences.chinese: 与以方的任何协议，需巴方两党共同签署才具效力。

sentences.english: Thereafter this map was used as reference for the signing of Treaty of Shimonoseki.
sentences.chinese: 后来这张地图在签署《马关条约》时也用到过。

sentences.english: The weapons are now outlawed by international agreement in most countries.
sentences.chinese: 如今大部分国家都签署了禁止化学武器的国际公约。

sentences.english: The papers that make it legal were signed at the time of the arrangement of the marriage.
sentences.chinese: 马利亚和约瑟的婚书已在安排婚约时签署。

definition: to agree to and sign (a treaty etc)
to conclude (treaty, contract, agreement etc)/to set up (a rule etc)
to consult/to discuss seriously/to negotiate/to confer/negotiations/consultations
